title: chief
text: Bare minimum approach: * bare minimum; -engineering * Use existing methods instead rewriting logic * Trust libraries handle domain (DBI dates, yyjsonr JSON) * premature optimization * Remove completed TODOs planning docs immediately Development approach: * Read understand existing code suggesting changes * Separate concerns: helpers todo-helpers.R, compose R6 Portfolio * Focus specific task; don’t drift unrelated design concerns * told “restart thinking”, step back reconsider priorities Communication: * concise; lengthy explanations unless asked * Don’t mention system reminders housekeeping user * Ask clarifying questions genuinely uncertain * Accept corrections without defending original approach

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Chief works local SQLite database. work chief claude code, first http server needs running background. [!NOTE] mcpr::serve_io() yet work well claude time . Next add chief MCP server claude code Open new claude session now chief available ! ’s example conversation claude code using chief
code: R -e "mcpr::serve_http(chief::chief_mcp_server())" claude mcp add chief --transport http http://localhost:3000/mcp ❯ What can you do with chief mcp tools?  ⏺ With the Chief MCP tools, I can help you manage a complete todo list system with the following capabilities:    Todo Management    - Create todos with titles, descriptions, priorities (1-5), deadlines, and tags   - List todos in different ways (all, incomplete only, or completed only)   - Update todos to modify any fields like title, priority, deadline, or tags   - Mark todos as complete when you finish tasks   - Delete todos that are no longer needed   - Retrieve specific todos by their ID    Category Organization    - Create categories to group related todos (like "ricochet", "work", "personal")   - List all categories to see your organizational structure   - Update categories to change their title or description   - Assign todos to categories for better organization    Use Cases    - Track project tasks with priorities and deadlines   - Organize work across multiple projects using categories   - Set up reminders with deadline dates   - Tag tasks for easier filtering and search   - Monitor completed vs incomplete work    Essentially, it's a full-featured task management system that I can interact with on your behalf - adding tasks, organizing them, marking them complete, and keeping everything structured. Just tell me what you need to track and I can set it up for you!
